metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27779 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. The cutmem command does not honor secure boot locking allowing an privileged attacker to remove address ranges from memory creating an opportunity to circumvent SecureBoot protections after proper triage about grub's memory layout. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability. It was discovered that the cutmem command in GRUB 2 did not honor secure boot locking. A local attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code and bypass UEFI Secure Boot restrictions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.164
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.164
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.04-1ubuntu42
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu42
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.04-1ubuntu42
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu42
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> grub2-unsigned will contain fixes and supersede grub2, which will contain only BIOS grub bits.

criterions.comment: grub2 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
grub2-signed package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.164').
grub2-unsigned package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.04-1ubuntu42').
